# Test Builds

> Repository for testing Read the Docs build configurations and scenarios

## Overview

This repository is used internally by Read the Docs to test different build scenarios and configurations. Each branch represents a specific test case or scenario that can be built independently to verify Read the Docs functionality.

## Purpose

- Create different build configuration scenarios
- Trigger builds on Read the Docs production
- Test specific use cases and edge cases
- Quality assurance for Read the Docs features

## Structure

- **Multiple branches**: Each branch represents a specific test scenario
- **Multiple tags**: Tags are used for version-specific testing
- **Branch naming**: Issue-specific branches follow the pattern `issue-{number}-{org|ext}`
- **Documentation**: Each scenario explains its purpose in `docs/index.rst`

## Key Files

- `.readthedocs.yaml`: Read the Docs configuration file
- `docs/conf.py`: Sphinx configuration
- `docs/index.rst`: Documentation and scenario description
- `requirements.txt`: Python dependencies

## Adding New Scenarios

1. Create a new branch from `main` with an appropriate name
2. Document the use case in `docs/index.rst`:
   - Explain success/failure criteria
   - Link to related issue tracker entries
3. Add or modify necessary configuration files:
   - Keep configurations minimal
   - Remove auto-generated comments
   - Remove unused configs
4. Push changes

## Documentation Tool

Uses Sphinx with the Read the Docs theme for documentation generation.

## Related Resources

- [All branches](https://github.com/readthedocs/test-builds/branches/)
- [All tags](https://github.com/readthedocs/test-builds/tags/)
